title: asyezuner
author: asyezuner
content: Volare project which many bounties compaign run by Julerz now going to Scam bounty participants wisely. They given user worthless token $mvolr in whisper and after they got some community and promotion they list Volr token in bsc network. now when community ask for  listing of mvolr then They came up with a new method of cheating. they will lock token for 6 month and no body will be able to make profit from this tokens. more than one year of hunters has been wasted in this shit project and Julerz is one of the worst bounty manager . his 9 out of ten project proved scam. he enjoyed fee in stable coin and hunter waiting for payment more than 9 months. please take action on this.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Quote from: asyezuner on March 01, 2023, 11:47:52 AMJulerz is one of the worst bounty manager . his 9 out of ten project proved scam. he enjoyed fee in stable coin and hunter waiting for payment more than 9 months. please take action on this. What action are you expecting? Should he be tagged for your laziness to do research?One thing you should know is that Julerz12 is not a part of the volare team he was only hired to run a bounty campaign and I'm very sure that he clearly wrote in the campaign what bounty hunters will be paid with which was mvolr but hunters were just too lazy to do research about the project. So calling him a scammer makes it look like he refused to distribute bounty payment and he ran away with it which didn't happen. If you have any complaint about the project you should take it to the project directly I believe they do have active social media handles and ask them directly why they have chosen to lock the token for 6 months maybe after the reason behind you can then proceed with your thread creation against the project and not the campaign manager.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: asyezuner on March 01, 2023, 11:47:52 AMVolare project which many bounties compaign run by Julerz now going to Scam bounty participants wisely. They given user worthless token $mvolr in whisper and after they got some community and promotion they list Volr token in bsc network. now when community ask for  listing of mvolr then They came up with a new method of cheating. they will lock token for 6 month and no body will be able to make profit from this tokens. more than one year of hunters has been wasted in this shit project and Julerz is one of the worst bounty manager . his 9 out of ten project proved scam. he enjoyed fee in stable coin and hunter waiting for payment more than 9 months. please take action on this. You need to first define what are the roles of bounty managers before you throw accusations, Julerz has no control over what action the developer team will do after the bounty campaign, he is out when it comes to decision-making, you know that because Julerz always put a disclaimer on every bounty campaign he is managing so stop barking at the wrong tree.This is the risk every bounty hunter should understand because the glory days of bounty hunting are over, bounty hunters now are risking their effort and time on every project that they are going to promote, even if you did your research it's still uncertain if the project you are promoting will turn to scam.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: Quote from: asyezuner on March 01, 2023, 11:47:52 AMVolare project which many bounties compaign run by Julerz now going to Scam bounty participants wisely. They given user worthless token $mvolr in whisper and after they got some community and promotion they list Volr token in bsc network. now when community ask for  listing of mvolr then They came up with a new method of cheating. they will lock token for 6 month and no body will be able to make profit from this tokens. more than one year of hunters has been wasted in this shit project and Julerz is one of the worst bounty manager . his 9 out of ten project proved scam. he enjoyed fee in stable coin and hunter waiting for payment more than 9 months. please take action on this. Hey mate, I believe before you take up any job offer here you already agreed to their terms and conditions of operation as they have the sole mandate to take decision at an given point in time. If you were not ok with the terms and conditions stated out for the bounty then why participating in the project bounty? And from what you have said you were paid for the work you did as a bounty hunter. Do you not know that the team has every right to make sure that they project their project in a good way every aspect? They have the final decision and they Make any decisions that suits the growth of their project token because that alone attracts investors when they have a good project at hand to showcase to the world at large. You are busy calling bounty manager names do you expect him to do research for you before joining his campaign? He did state his conditions of engagement before you took part in the bounty. You should not be angry at the bounty manager because he is not part of the team he is just a bounty manager hired to manage the bounty for the project.

comments.author: aioc
comments.body: Quote from: asyezuner on March 01, 2023, 11:47:52 AM.....Julerz is one of the worst bounty manager . his 9 out of ten project proved scam. he enjoyed fee in stable coin and hunter waiting for payment more than 9 months. please take action on this. If it is proven that he is managing a campaign that is a scam project while the campaign is ongoing then you can say that he is the worst manager but after the campaign is over and the team is the one who will decide on the future of the program and he is out of it then no you are making a wrong assumption.You have to read Julerz's disclaimer on the bounty campaign that is he managing, by joining you have taken a risk and you cannot blame the bounty manager anymore.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5441350.0QuoteDisclaimer: I am only the Bounty Campaign Manager for this project. I am paid only to manage this bounty campaign.I will not be held responsible should the developers/project team fail to reach their stated goals/obligations to the bounty participants, investors, and everyone else.THIS BOUNTY CAMPAIGN DO NOT HAVE AN OFFICIAL ESCROW TO ITS BOUNTY POOL. THE BOUNTY CAMPAIGN MANAGER CANNOT GUARANTEE THE REWARDS AT THE END OF THE CAMPAIGN. Join (on this bounty campaign), invest (on their ICO/IDO/IEO), or use their platform at your own risk.

comments.author: AmoreJaz
comments.body: Quote from: aioc on March 01, 2023, 09:14:04 PMQuote from: asyezuner on March 01, 2023, 11:47:52 AM.....Julerz is one of the worst bounty manager . his 9 out of ten project proved scam. he enjoyed fee in stable coin and hunter waiting for payment more than 9 months. please take action on this. If it is proven that he is managing a campaign that is a scam project while the campaign is ongoing then you can say that he is the worst manager but after the campaign is over and the team is the one who will decide on the future of the program and he is out of it then no you are making a wrong assumption.You have to read Julerz's disclaimer on the bounty campaign that is he managing, by joining you have taken a risk and you cannot blame the bounty manager anymore.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5441350.0QuoteDisclaimer: I am only the Bounty Campaign Manager for this project. I am paid only to manage this bounty campaign.I will not be held responsible should the developers/project team fail to reach their stated goals/obligations to the bounty participants, investors, and everyone else.THIS BOUNTY CAMPAIGN DO NOT HAVE AN OFFICIAL ESCROW TO ITS BOUNTY POOL. THE BOUNTY CAMPAIGN MANAGER CANNOT GUARANTEE THE REWARDS AT THE END OF THE CAMPAIGN. Join (on this bounty campaign), invest (on their ICO/IDO/IEO), or use their platform at your own risk.he has no responsibilities after the end of the campaign. but if during the campaign, there's scam going on, then that's his prerogative to stop or pause the campaign. and if he is still continuing the campaign with proof of scam, then he should be tagged. but if the campaign is already over, he has no control of what will happen to the project as he is not part of it. this is why if you don't want to be screwed by these bounty programs and just wasting your time, better not to participate. look for other worthwhile activities that you think you can truly earn for yourself.

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: It's funny that you just join bounties without even reading the terms or the road maps of the projects you are advertising, only to get surprised once they implement something they had planned a while ago. Who is to blame?Maybe you should wake up and stop advertising for projects that will;l give you worthless tokens in exchange for your time wasted. It clearly shows that you don't value your time.

comments.author: Saisher
comments.body: This is a case of one's frustration and he needs someone to blame for his failed expectation, he can report the project, and report the developers but the bounty manager after the bounty campaign should not be part of the blame, they have done their part, people investigated the project and sometimes even a good manager could make an error and he is late to find out because the developers change the direction of the roadmap, so don't rely on the bounty managers only, do your own research and be responsible on all your action.

comments.author: Cryptomiles1
comments.body: @Julerz12 has been in this industry for long and besides he doesn't have spiritual eyes to foresee a good project or not. Keep note that before any campaign is being launched they have their rules and regulations that governs all bounty hunters while enrolling in any of their campaign or being launched by other bounty managers. There is nothing to hold him responsible for not listing or releasing your rewards, now look very carefully every project has their roadmap and token vesting periods they will unlock it when they seems the time is due.Why not try to focus on the discussion board to know about project development learn more about bitcoin than wasting your precious time wallowing in bounty campaign. Maybe when next you are joining any bounty you should focus very more on reading their instructions.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Damn I also just remembered that I also took part in this bounty by invitation. I wasn't following updates anymore until I found this thread. There seems to be a lot of new terms for exchanging rewards that weren't previously written into the campaign agreement. KYC, locking up, limitations.Quote from: logfiles on March 01, 2023, 09:37:25 PMIt's funny that you just join bounties without even reading the terms or the road maps of the projects you are advertising,Violating the road map plan seems to be a common thing to do lately,

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Quote from: rat03gopoh on March 01, 2023, 11:57:19 PMDamn I also just remembered that I also took part in this bounty by invitation. I wasn't following updates anymore until I found this thread. There seems to be a lot of new terms for exchanging rewards that weren't previously written into the campaign agreement. KYC, locking up, limitations.Do they have an Announcement thread here?Change of the terms can be easy to track using the different web page archiving sites.Quote from: rat03gopoh on March 01, 2023, 11:57:19 PMViolating the road map plan seems to be a common thing to do lately,Yeah, I used to see it back in the days of ICO hype too.I think people should just wake up and stop advertising projects to give out worthless tokens. If they can't pay out market listed tokens or Bitcoins, them fuck 'em.

comments.author: dansus021
comments.body: You already get the answer  but it is what it is what are you got into facebook, twitter or article. If you think is unfair or scam and can make your reputation bad just delete your previous post. and like the other you have to Do Your Own Research first before do any kind of bounty or straight away just do it, but sometime you will get  ash token. Me personally not just one or two bounty who doesn't pay or the token is worthless but it is one of the risk

comments.author: shasan
comments.body: Quote from: asyezuner on March 01, 2023, 11:47:52 AMVolare project which many bounties compaign run by Julerz now going to Scam bounty participants wisely. They given user worthless token $mvolr in whisper and after they got some community and promotion they list Volr token in bsc network. now when community ask for  listing of mvolr then They came up with a new method of cheating. they will lock token for 6 month and no body will be able to make profit from this tokens. more than one year of hunters has been wasted in this shit project and Julerz is one of the worst bounty manager . his 9 out of ten project proved scam. he enjoyed fee in stable coin and hunter waiting for payment more than 9 months. please take action on this. If any campaign got to be scammed then the participant of the bounty should be responsible more than the campaign manager. While you are taking part in the participants. If any project becomes scammed then all the participants should be responsible as they promoted the project and that's why investors got scammed. But you are taking part in those participants and blaming the manager only for the loss of the participants.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: 🚧 [REWARDS SENT] Volare Network_________________________ you need to read the rules before joining any bounty, there's a rule of the team and the campaign manager reserve the right to change anything including the distribution reward. You should avoid any bounty which have such kind rule if you don't want to face this problem again in the future.What are you wish to take action about your accusation? red tagged and create a flag to Julerz12? you can do it yourself and we will see how many users are support or oppose your flag, for me I would oppose the flag since bounty it's what it's.

comments.author: albon
comments.body: Quote from: asyezuner on March 01, 2023, 11:47:52 AMVolare project which many bounties compaign run by Julerz now going to Scam bounty participants wisely. They given user worthless token $mvolr in whisper and after they got some community and promotion they list Volr token in bsc network. now when community ask for  listing of mvolr then They came up with a new method of cheating. they will lock token for 6 month and no body will be able to make profit from this tokens. more than one year of hunters has been wasted in this shit project and Julerz is one of the worst bounty manager . his 9 out of ten project proved scam. he enjoyed fee in stable coin and hunter waiting for payment more than 9 months. please take action on this. They already distributed the tokens. As for the tokens being worthless, this may be due to the failure of the project team to make their currency a success and because of the lack of investors interested in this currency or because of the lack of liquidity and capital and other reasons, so I see that it is not the bounty manager’s fault but rather your fault because you did not take sufficient time to do research and review the goals of the project and the level of experience of its team. If the project fails and its currency does not succeed in attracting investors and turns into a scam, then this is indeed the fault of the team. Also, no one can predict this, regardless of his experience and skills. Once again, you have to review the project that you will work to promote and review the currency information that you will receive before wasting your time and blaming others.

comments.author: dbc23
comments.body: OP failed to do research before participating in Volare Project and is trying to make the project manager go against the Terms and condition for participating in the Bounty. Bounty hunting is not a forceful venture and every bounty program have their terms so it is left for the intended participant to conclude if they are willing to participate and it should also be noted that the value of the coin or token is largely dependent on how much volume the coin accumulates as well as demand.

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: Sorry for the loss, but such scam will not stop unless everyone stops promoting bounty projects unless they pay in bitcoin or any altcoin listed on many platforms (they can paying part of the campaign amount in tokens will be better.)The campaign manager is responsible for the duration of the campaign’s continuity and obtaining payments. If you did not get payments, the manager is responsible, but if you got them and were unable to sell them, then the fault is not his fault.I remember once I joined one of the campaigns that sell using NFT, unfortunately I could not sell it.

comments.author: ScamViruS
comments.body: Quote from: asyezuner on March 01, 2023, 11:47:52 AMVolare project which many bounties compaign run by Julerz now going to Scam bounty participants wisely. They given user worthless token $mvolr in whisper and after they got some community and promotion they list Volr token in bsc network. now when community ask for  listing of mvolr then They came up with a new method of cheating. they will lock token for 6 month and no body will be able to make profit from this tokens. more than one year of hunters has been wasted in this shit project and Julerz is one of the worst bounty manager . his 9 out of ten project proved scam. he enjoyed fee in stable coin and hunter waiting for payment more than 9 months. please take action on this. I think the participants are more responsible than the bounty manager if the campaign is scammed. They participate in the bounty without doing any research during the campaign and later cry when the bounty is scammed. So after receiving the bounty payment, why should the manager be held responsible for that token worthless? I guess like other busy bounty hunters you didn't have time to read the bounty campaign terms and conditions.

comments.author: Woodie
comments.body: Quote from: asyezuner on March 01, 2023, 11:47:52 AMVolare project which many bounties compaign run by Julerz now going to Scam bounty participants wisely. They given user worthless token $mvolr in whisper and after they got some community and promotion they list Volr token in bsc network. Dont you think as a bounty participant you have acted too fast on this information, think about the investors who bought this token earlier with their hard earned money and are yet to get this token swap news, give the team the benefit of the doubt to deliver as these impementations dont just happen overnightQuote from: asyezuner on March 01, 2023, 11:47:52 AMnow when community ask for  listing of mvolr then They came up with a new method of cheating. they will lock token for 6 month and no body will be able to make profit from this tokens. more than one year of hunters has been wasted in this shit project and Julerz is one of the worst bounty manager . his 9 out of ten project proved scam. he enjoyed fee in stable coin and hunter waiting for payment more than 9 months. please take action on this. Why do I feel this is not about the project but some kind of character assassination  , BTw just so you know back in the day locking of coins to figure out the way forward was common and if the project failed to find a lasting solution because of markets crashing or not reaching soft/hard cap, and if funds raised could not start off the project.. refunds were initiated to all investors that bought the tokens.Honestly, I would say give team Volare the benefit of the doubt for now, and whats the campaign manager's position on this issue??Quote from: Husires on March 08, 2023, 04:38:18 PMSorry for the loss, but such scam will not stop unless everyone stops promoting bounty projects unless they pay in bitcoin or any altcoin listed on many platforms The pain of being a bounty hunter is never an easy path, and unfortunately paying with their native token is the only way to cut costs unlike paying with btc or any established coin which could rise their budgets on the marketing side of things.

comments.author: ololajulo
comments.body: It is important for hunters to learn to take reasonable risks as campaigns lengthen and activities increase. Any bounty campaign that goes beyond 6 weeks without payment is too long and risky. Everyone is vulnerable to scams in cryptocurrency, regardless of the certainty behind any research, so take your risk reasonably. I'm so concerned about IEO's demise in the space, I found it the safest haven for any holder, even if the project fails, some exchanges are capable of holding and managing the coins for profit.
